reviews.text: We had eleven people ages 9-70 in our family's party and Miss Pam took great care of us all! Our reservations were all promptly taken care of via several emails. Pam is a delightful woman and easy to work with. Her beautiful home in Cobh is just a few minutes from town and is absolutely lovely. It is clean, well-kept, nicely appointed and Pam is a fantastic cook. The en-suites are very large and personalized. Pam welcomed us into the formal living room upon our arrival and offered us tea, coffee, scones. She also took the time to find out what types of attractions we wanted to visit and offered suggestions for sight seeing and dinner. We had delicious made-to-order hot breakfasts the following morning before departing. Great experience for our entire family.
reviews.title: Great B&B - reasonably priced, delicious food, most welcoming host and hostess!

reviews.text: We had 6 people travelling together, representing three generations of my family. When we arrived, we were offered tea after we had settled in, and it was lovely. This was something I missed at the various B&Bs during this trip to Ireland, but it may have been partly because we were arriving late so often. Pam could not have been more hospitable, and friendly! She gave us recommendations for dinner and St. Coleman's for Mass, but we didn't make it to Mass on time. It is a beautiful cathedral, though!
reviews.title: A short stay made to seem longer and more relaxed due to great hospitality!

reviews.text: My husband and I shared our room with our son, and Pam said she could just move another bed in for him while we were at dinner, When we returned, there was a beautiful bed all made up, nicer than his bed at home, and I couldn't imagine how she just "moved" that in!
reviews.title: Great Location and a Great B & B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pam was very friendly and made us all feel like old friends staying over. As others have mentioned, the breakfast was delicious, and her scones were brilliant as well. We really enjoyed Knockeven House!
reviews.title: Haven on a rainy day

reviews.text: Knockeven house is beautiful and Pamela is a warm, wonderful hostess! On our arrival we were escorted into the living room area where we were greeted with tea and scones and a warm fire on a chilly wet day in Ireland. Our rooms were spacious, the beds were very comfortable and the view (our room was in the front of the house) of Cobh was great! Our breakfast was delicious and Pam offered many choices fruit/yogurt/breads/cheeses/meats and hot breakfast too! The Knockeven house is well located for day trips to Kinsale, Blarney Castle and Cork. Pam is very helpful with suggestions of places to go and what to see. We really enjoyed our stay at the Knockeven House!
reviews.title: Afternoon Tea

reviews.text: We have been in a lot of beautiful hotels around the world over the years, but this place is up with the very best of them.
reviews.title: Unbelievable, best B&B yet!!

reviews.text: Pamela and John were just the best hosts, tea and scones to start our stay and even a large glass of wine and lovely chat to end the night...
reviews.title: Just lovely

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's an old 1800's house restored to perfection..old but so warm and inviting.
reviews.title: What a magnificent house
Lovely accommodations and gracious host
reviews.text: The five guest rooms were just unreal, old style, warm and luxurious to the last.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was equally as perfect, full Irish and everything else besides!
reviews.title: Superb!

reviews.text: This was a great B&B at a great house and a great price. Pam welcomed us with tea and homemade scones even though we arrived at 9:30. This was a welcome treat after a long day of travel. The house was beautiful and the room we were in was BIG!!! We had the whole house to ourselves since no other guest was staying there that night. What a surprise! I wish we could have stayed for a few additional day but unfortunately we had to leave early. Despite this, Pam made us a wonderful breakfast and recommended things to see on our way to our next city.
reviews.title: All to ourselves!

reviews.text: This is one of the loveliest B & B's by far. Pam was very accomodating to our needs and always willing to make everyone feel at home. Beautiful rooms and her selection in food was wonderful. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and this little seaport town.
reviews.title: Lovely surroundings, lovely service

reviews.text: This is a lovely B&B on the coastal town of Ireland. Compared to other B&Bs, this one is outstanding. The rooms are well appointed and nicely decorated. The hostess and owner is very gracious and prepares a deluxe breakfast. Its location is close to town which offers serveral nice restaurants. I definitely recommend it and hope to return again,
reviews.title: Excellent B&B

reviews.text: Pam could not have been any more gracious. The evening meal she served was second to none. It was the first day we arrived and it was so relaxing. This B&B was one of the best places we stayed at on our trip. A must if you are in the area.
reviews.title: Brilliant, spectacular, awesome
Outstanding luxury B&B at a value!
reviews.text: This gorgeous period home was one of our two favorite B&Bs on our trip. The house has large rooms and the true feel of a period estate. Pam was a great hostess with terrific recommendations on restaurants and other things in the area. Do NOT miss the scones and cheese selecting at breakfast. I could not stop myself!! The breakfast was served in a beautiful dining room around one large table where the different guests can enjoy each other's company. The price is very reasonable for such a lavish period home!
Pam greets you into her home with a warm fire, tea and the BEST scones in Ireland. Her rooms are big and warm. Knockeven house is just grand!
reviews.title: First stay and the best

reviews.text: We spent one night in Knockeven house May 10th. We were warmly greeted by Pam and she offered refreshments when we arrived. She also went out of her way to drop us in town ( a few min down the road). The Irish breakfast accompanied by freshly baked scones was excellent.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms were very grand and spacious. Thoroughly enjoyed.
reviews.title: Excellent B & B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Knockeven was one of our best B & B experience in Ireland. Tastefully furnished manor house with big rooms and a great shower! Pam and John are gracious hosts and Pam is a font of information about anything in the area; her suggestion for a visit to Ardmore on our way to Kilknenny was a very good suggestion. Excellent breakfast and the scones are the best!
reviews.title: Best scones of the whole trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed two nights at the end of April. Pam could not have been nicer. Bar none the best scones of the 12 day trip. The house and furnishings could use some freshening up. A little worn.
reviews.title: Lovely house, lovely hospitality
